title: I'm level 86, my adc still throws won games for not buying Grievous Wounds.
body: Now please tell me how matchmaking is ok.

it means even less than mastery

how do people still think that level means literally anything? there are people who have been playing for 8 years and are still bronze. their level would be multiple hundreds higher than it is if riot had removed the level cap earlier.

while this is true, the fact that you can be placed into a game as a new player with someone who possibly has 10,000 games means _LITERALLY _**SOMETHING**.  Especially when trying to get your friends into the game.

Sure the dudes a hardstuck bronze 3, but he stills has leaps and bounds of game knowledge and experience over anything a new player will.

Im level 158, and while that doesnt auto make me diamond+.  (I think im silver currently.) But my silver elo means less than my level in my case, **ive never played more than 100 games in a ranked season, but i have over 12,000 unranked games and nearly 5k arams played total(over 150x the experience of my ranked games), and new players are frequently placed higher ranking than i am currently.** So take any ranking with a grain of salt.

i correct my previous post. _level after 30_ means literally nothing. you know there are "level brackets" pre-30, right? you don't get matched with 30s until around level 25 unless you're premade with a 30.

Level is about how much you play, and has no correlation to how well you do in a game. The only thing having a high level does is not allow someone brand spanking new to enter a game with you (I mean the other players have at least played co-op)
I feel you brother. I still have to explain to people why they should buy LDR and to focus towers - it's getting real old.
